subject: RE: [junit] Re: Using JUnit for Performance Tests?
msgSnippet: I ve found the JUnit task of ANT to be extremely good.  It provides timings of the executed function and everything. Being new at JUnit, the timing tests are
messageBody:
I've found the JUnit task of ANT to be extremely good. It provides timings of the executed
function and everything.

Being new at JUnit, the timing tests are what alerted me to the fact that JUnit reloads stuff
before each test (something I didn't know before I found the ANT task.)

Bob Bateman
Senior Java Developer
Priority Appraisal


--- Michael Silverstein <msilverstein@...> wrote:
> Also, there's a product called "Enhanced Junit" that adds distributed
> load testing of JUnit tests across multiple VMs and processors to JUnit.
> You can download it and read a bit about it at
> http://www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit/.
